item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Just looked at the test page, looks much improved. It's currently lacking the big "Welcome to this Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition wiki" thing at the top, I assume that's unintentional?

If I had to make a change to the current test page lineage section, I'd add an extra line break before both "Setting Specific" and "Custom" (and maybe UA as well, for consistency) to set them more apart. It'd set them more apart, and we have the space for it. But, overall, super nice work. This is much better than the current home page.

EDIT: Oh, and you're missing Spelljammer under setting specific! And I suppose dragonlance as well, since the Kender page is now up?


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Take a look at the test page, let me know what you think, I reset it back to 3 columns and moved the Setting Specific, Custom, & Unearthed Arcana to the same column as the Monstrous.

As for the wrong icon for the races… yeah, that wasn't intentional lol. It should be fixed now.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
I don't understand how to get to the basic races from the home page.

On the homepage, scroll down or click "races" to go to the lineage section. From there, click "Common" to go to a list of common lineages, which includes Human, Elf, and Dwarf.

On that note, it's a bit odd that the race/lineage section on the homepage uses the artificer's gears icon instead of the "people" icon that the race section used before, and still uses at the top of the page. Is that intentional, Fredbob? Seems a bit of an odd choice to me.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
I don't understand how to get to the basic races from the home page. When I click "Races" none of the links in that section lead to entries about basic Dwarf, Elf, Human, etc. It's all just custom lineages.

I was able to find the Dwarf page (for example) via Google search, but as best I can tell you can't get there from the home page.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Unless there are objections to the widening of the content space on the main page

Was just about to bring that up, actually. Changing the entire width of the front page for this seems a bit odd. With the length of the Exotic column, I think it'd be easy to fit Setting Specific, Custom, and UA under Monstrous. That way, I'm pretty sure the width would be the same as the current homepage, and the length wouldn't get any longer since Exotic is already longer than those categories combined.

Thanks again for your help with this, Fredbob.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
I moved 'Custom' to just above 'Unearthed Arcana', that does look better, thanks for the suggestion.

I tried the table concept, and it just doesn't really fit on the main page. Mainly because the simple table (using the '||' to create the table) has no way of removing the lines between rows. Since we don't have those anywhere else on the main page it looks kind of out of place. Our only other option would be advanced tables (essentially html). And while I can do that, it'd take a little while and make maintaining those lists a harder because it's a lot more code and making sure you've got all the opening and closing tags lined up. Especially since we keep things alphabetical and so we insert in the middle of lists sometimes.

Unless there are objections to the widening of the content space on the main page. I think what we have on that test page is what we'll go with on the main page.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Looks awesome! I second moving Custom to the end of the third column though as well, even just as 'Custom Lineage'. Other than that, that is beautiful!

EDIT: Another option instead of widening the page to do four columns, is to lengthen it going down the page, similarly to what was there before but originally in two columns — something like below or even doing the left "column" going down like this and the right column with the way it is?

Common

Dragonborn Dwarf Elf
Gnome Half-Elf Halfling
Half-Orc Human Tiefling

item.title: Re: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded:
I'm seeing 502 errors on many pages - about 20% of the time I try to load anything. It's not consistent.

I found that if I clear my cache, the affected page will load immediately with no problems.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors

item.title: Broken Links
item.content:encoded:
I use this site a lot during character creation but recently I keep getting 502 errors on random pages. To combat this I took a mirror of the entire site so I can load the missing pages locally. In the process of changing the links on the mirrored pages to redirect to my other local pages I discovered a few mistyped or otherwise broken links.

[artificer] "spells:cure-wounds" should be "spell:cure-wounds"
[artificer:armorer-ua] "spell:greater-invisibilty" should be "spell:greater-invisibility"
[background:gruul-anarch] "spell:dominante-beast" should be "spell:dominate-beast"
[background:sword-coast-heroic-chronicle] "background:Cloistered" should be "background:cloistered-scholar"
[background:sword-coast-heroic-chronicle] "background:spy" should be "background:criminal#toc1"
[epic-boons] "spells:plane-shift" should be "spell:plane-shift"
[fighter:monster-hunter-ua] "spelldetect-magic" should be "spell:detect-magic"
[lineage:kalashtar] "dream" should be "spell:dream" x2
[lineage:kalashtar] "sleep" should be "spell:sleep" x2
[sorcerer:clockwork-soul-ua] "spell:protection-from-good-and-evil" should be "spell:protection-from-evil-and-good" (link text wrong too)
[supernatural-gifts] "piety" (missing page?)
[warlock:celestial-ua] "spell:buuning-hands" should be "spell:burning-hands"
[warlock:ghost-in-the-machine-ua] "spell:haywire" should be "spell:haywire-ua"
[wizard:artificer-ua:magic-item-tables] "wondrous-items:dust-of-dissapearance" should be "wondrous-items:dust-of-disappearance" (link text wrong too)
[wizard:artificer-ua:magic-item-tables] "wondrous-items:goggle-of-night" should be "wondrous-items:goggles-of-night" (link text wrong too)
[wizard:artificer-ua:magic-item-tables] "wondrous-items:Potion-of-greater-healing" should be "wondrous-items:potion-of-healing"
[wondrous-items:all] "wondrous-items:shield" (missing page?)
[wondrous-items:cauldron-of-rebirth] "wondrous-items:potion-of-greater-healing" should be "wondrous-items:potion-of-healing"
[wondrous-items:demonomicon-of-iggwilv] "wondrous-items:fraz-urbluus-staff" (missing page?)
[wondrous-items:the-infernal-machine-of-lum-the-mad] "spell:conjure-minor-elemental" should be "spell:conjure-minor-elementals" (link text wrong too)

Hope this is helpful and thank you to everyone who contributes to this site.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Broken Links

item.title: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Looks great! Personally, I'd move the "Custom" link to the very end instead of the very start, as right now it kind of looks like it says "Custom Common" or something, but apart from that, it's much better!


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded:
I'm getting a ton of these now too! Random stuff from certain wizard spells to weapons, then druid spells will work fine.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors

item.title: Re: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists
item.content:encoded:
We could do that for spells that came out with Tasha's, but Tasha's also expanded the spell lists of classes with spells that were released in earlier books, including from the PHB.

For example, Teleportation Circle is from the PHB, but got added to the warlock spell list by Tasha's.

We obviously shouldn't mark that spell as a Tasha's spell, but we don't have a way to mark it only for the warlock spell list. It's just a limitation of how we've got this set up right now. And again, I'm just not sure how we'd do it, unless we set up a separate page for each spell for each class that has access to it.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
So something like this?
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/home:test

item.content:encoded:
I am seeing the same thing constantly on the backrooms Wikidot too and it is very frustrating as I'm trying to read it and at one second it just does the error. And some are extremely bad like Level 600 constantly does the error 24/7 and only works every little second.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
About the only compromise type of edit that I can think of is to list just the Standard lineages and the Monstrous races; and then have page redirects for the setting-specific lineages or something

Exotic ones too, but yes, I agree here. Setting specific / UA absolutely does not need to be on the front page, but I'd very much like the others.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists
item.content:encoded:
Is it not possible to treat Tasha's as a new category — like how you can click to view all spells by school, or all ritual spells, regardless of class?? And then just create a superscript for it on the individual spell pages that just lets players know 'hey, this spell is a Tasha's spell'?


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Sorry for slow reply — there isn't any sort of notification system about these forums or a link to jump here so I had to Google to get back here lol

Yes, it had been a while since I checked the Aasimar page - at the time of my last checking, it was missing its base level information (age, alignment, etc) for its uppermost section; and only had the new revised information. If that has been fixed, I haven't checked lately and I apologize for that.

I suppose I can kind of see where you're coming from with the race list getting expansive, but I guess I'm just a weird one that prefers one page that has links instead of having to click into two or three pages to get where I want to go. Same with if the Backgrounds and Feats section get collapsed into page hops too. I don't think there's really a way to compromise between the two, honestly, unless you have a way to expand the content container of the main page to be wider so you could have more columns across and shorter column lists.

About the only compromise type of edit that I can think of is to list just the Standard lineages and the Monstrous races; and then have page redirects for the setting-specific lineages or something — that way at least the most commonly used races are available straight from the main page without extra hops.

I can't comment on the discussion - I only recently actually created an account for the wikidot website, so I wasn't able to view any history of edits or anything until just a little while back.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space
item.content:encoded:
With the new lineages, the plan was to create a master page that used the include statement to pull in data from other sub-pages to build out the whole thing. You can check out any of the primary lineages for how some of the others have been built. Should keep the pages a bit smaller and therefore easier to maintain especially when new subraces are released.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space

item.title: Re: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space
item.content:encoded:
I added a Spelljammer section the setting specific lineages on the Lineage page. You'll have to be the one to add the shortcut to the main page, as well as adding the two backgrounds to the main page also.

Do we have an Archived section for the race/lineage UAs?


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
I'm not sure what data is missing? The Volo's Aasimar is still there Aasimar. Is there some text missing that you're looking for?

I think they're talking about the error on the Aasimar lineage page that I reported here on the 19th, and you fixed a day later. Either they haven't checked the page since then, or their browser still had the old version cached, I assume.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Valkyria! Did you get the main Lineage page updated with the new ones? I think the plan was as lineages were published they would get removed from the UA section and added to the main page for the published version.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space

item.title: Re: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents stuff has been fixed on the main page. My apologies on that, I always forget to update that when I make changes on the main page to the number of headers out there.

I'm not sure what data is missing? The Volo's Aasimar is still there Aasimar. Is there some text missing that you're looking for? Both sets of pages existed for quite a while and I think we were pretty thorough with making sure we transferred all the data over. If you can point me to which races are broken or missing I'll definitely take a look.

The point of moving them off the main page was to reduce the clutter and it was getting harder and harder to keep the Races organized in that generic list. What if the ToC took you to the main Lineage page instead of that section of the main page?

Another driver of the changes was that the pages themselves had never been included in their own category on the site (ie dnd5e.wikidot.com/aasimar vs. dnd5e.wikidot.com/lineage:aasimar). There are several other sections on the main page that are in the same boat; namely backgrounds and feats. Lineages just ended up being the one tackled because of the category issue as well. I don't know if/when we'll do something to those other two to try and clean them up.

There was a discussion on the lineage page changes a while ago when we were planning them, nobody objected at the time. They sat out there for quite a while before we finally pushed them to the main page. Even had a test version of the home page for people to look at.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Races missing
item.content:encoded:
The 502 errors are something I think are out of our control. I don't see how the new lineage pages could be causing 502 errors, they're no more taxing than anything else we have on the site. And they've existed for months before these errors started popping up, they just weren't linked on the main page. With how many sites wikidot hosts I wonder if they're hitting some kind of limit on the resources they have available/paid for. Based on comments in the support forum it doesn't look like the creator of wikidot is very involved anymore, so he could be letting everything run on autopilot.

I responded on your other thread about putting the races back on the main page.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Races missing

item.title: Re: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space
item.content:encoded:
I've now finished adding all the new Spelljammer content and updated the relevant pages with the Errata corrections.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space

item.title: Can we put the Races back on the main page?
item.content:encoded:
Please? Not only is it vastly more convenient to have the races listed individually and accessibly directly from the main page, instead of having to click and redirect to a 'category' page and then redirect to the race you want, but whoever decided they needed to revamp practically the entire race section back in April (according to history logs) also broke the 'Table of Contents' navigation - the links do not jump to those sections anymore and are off now. They also broke some of the races and some races are missing information (ie. Volo's Aasimar information, etc.)

Can we please just fix and revert that?


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Can we put the Races back on the main page?

item.title: Re: Races missing
item.content:encoded:
The 502 error is widespread and not tied specifically to races.

That being said, whatever editor/moderator decided to go ham back in April and completely try to reorganize all of the races into new pages instead of being accessible from the main page like they had been; reorganize all of the Unearthed Arcana into a single category (removing the UA book names from everything); changed all the urls of pages and redirected all the links to them…. it messed with a lot of things. For example, Volo's version of Aasimar was missing last I checked.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Races missing

item.title: Re: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded:
Yep, something is definitely wrong — and 502 is primarily a server overload error; which means it is on Wikidot's end and not the user. This error has been happening more and more for at least the past month or so. It's gotten to the point I'm constantly joking with my friends that Wizards of the Coast is DDoS-ing the site because it provides game info. XD


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors

item.title: Races missing
item.content:encoded:
Not sure if anyone else has the same issue, but it seems that the races are missing from the main page and trying to go straight to some of the individual race pages ends in a 502 error. Has something changed with the site or is this just a bug?


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Races missing

item.title: Re: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded:
Yup, something is up. If I change browsers, it goes away temporarily and then slowly starts coming back. Emptying the cache doesn't seem to solve it.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors

item.title: Re: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded:
I'm not on here as much as I used to be so I don't know if that's why I haven't encountered it? Intermittent problems like that are hard to diagnose though. Since nothing major has changed on the site my best guess would be that wikidot changed something on their backend causing them to occasionally send a bad response. Or whatever wikidot changed isn't being recognized by some server along the chain from the hosting back to the user.

There are so many links in the chain and any one of them could be responsible unfortunately.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors

item.title: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors
item.content:encoded:
Hi!

I've been using this website for a while now, and as of recent I've noticed a lot of 502 errors. I saw one mentioned already with Fire Genasi, but it's covered a lot of different pages - spell:summon-aberration, spells:wizard, etc. Many spells and other options seem to frequently return these errors, some lasting for several days at a time.

From what I know about these, it's possible that they can be from my end instead of the server's - I have been able to access some of those pages while in Incognito mode. But, since I'm not the only one, I was curious about what others have found and think is happening.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Increasing amount of 502 (Bad Gateway) Errors

item.title: Re: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for this! You seem to have missed the changes in the Errata, however. It mostly affects the Hadozee and Astral Elf.

Forum thread: Spelljammer: Adventures in Space

item.title: Aasimar lineage page error
item.content:encoded:
On the Aasimar Lineage page, the following error is displayed:

Included page "lineage:aasimar-core-vgm" does not exist (create it now)

It seems the page refers to the nonexistent page "lineage:aasimar-core-vgm". Instead, it should be referring to the page "lineage:aasimar-vgm", which does exist.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Aasimar lineage page error

item.title: Re: Incorrect spell lists for Bard
item.content:encoded:
Hi bsea219,

The following spells are listed as Bard spells (on this website) due to them being a part of the expanded spell list from the optional 'Additional Bard Spells' feature provided in Tasha's:

  • Color Spray
  • Command
  • Aid
  • Enlarge/Reduce
  • Mirror Image
  • Intellect Fortress
  • Mass Healing Word
  • Slow
  • Phantasmal Killer
  • Rarys Telepathic Bond (Ritual)
  • Heroes Feast
  • Dream of the Blue Veil
  • Prismatic Spray
  • Antipathy/Sympathy
  • Prismatic Wall

Currently, there's yet to be a distinction implemented to mark these particular spells (as well as the optional additional spells on other casters) as part of the optional 'Additional spells' feature(s).

Hope this clears up any confusion!


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Incorrect spell lists for Bard

item.title: Incorrect spell lists for Bard
item.content:encoded:
Two spells that I've noticed so far (Color Spray, Mirror Image) are listed as bard spells on this website, but are not considered bard spells on D&D Beyond. I don't know if D&D Beyond is missing information, if the spells have been updated recently, or if the information on the Wikidot is incorrect, but I figured I'd point it out just in case!!!


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Incorrect spell lists for Bard

item.title: Re: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists
item.content:encoded:
It's a good idea, but I'm not sure how we'd implement it. The current superscripts are on the spell pages, which aren't specific to a given class. If we added the superscript for Tasha's on the spell page, it would look like the spell was an expanded spell list for every class. And I don't know if there's something we can do on the PageList module that we use to display the list of spells.


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists

item.title: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists
item.content:encoded:
I think it'd be helpful to note which spells were offered via Tasha's expanded spells, which are technically optional. This would be a pretty big undertaking but I think is worth it to avoid future confusion. A superscript T like how we treated the Dunamancy/Chronurgy spells would be pretty elegant.

How do we feel about this?


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: Noting Tasha's expansioned class spell lists

item.title: Spelljammer Lineages
item.content:encoded:
Was going through the new Lineage page and noticed quite a few of the lineages from Spelljammer are still listed as part of the unearthed arcana section, despite having official release versions. Is there any particular reason for that or is it just a question of them not having been updated yet? (Also as a note, if anyone with edit perms needs me to send them the current versions from the Spelljammer book+errata let me know)

item.title: New actual play - Level Quest - starts Nov 9th
item.content:encoded:
Hi y'all,

Im Kory, the DM for a new D&D actual play stream called Level Quest airing Wednesdays at 7:00 pm PT on Twitch. Real people, remote play, melodrama, inappropriate comedy the usual.
Session #1 is scheduled for Nov. 9th Nov. 23rd wed be honored to have you check out our story.

THE SETTING - ILLISTERA
Level Quest takes place in the world of Illistera (ILL-is-TARE-uh) an unforgiving and elemental land yet ravaged by echoes of the past the brightest minds are still trying to understand. Civilization struggles forward despite raging storms and violent neighbors. Hungering monstrosities await the foolhardy braving the wilds in search of glory and long-buried treasures.

THE CAMPAIGN - SOULBOUND
The PCs are regular folk. Commoners thrust into a story larger than they could have imagined, beset by visions of the past, and bestowed with power beyond the reach of most. What they choose to do with it well, thats what were here to find out.

The land is as threatening as its denizens, meaning survival is far from guaranteed for our heroes. They do, however, have one advantage

If death simply meant a new beginning, how would you approach life? Would you sacrifice yourself for a cause knowing all it costs is time? We explore these questions and more as the PCs are born again and again, reckoning with the long-term consequences of their actions in a manner unseen in most campaigns.

The decisions will be difficult.
The challenges brutal.
Welcome to Illistera.

*

If you want to see some clips or the full vid of our tech run part 2 from last night (11/2) find us on Twitch. Nothing shown there is canon :P

Thanks for reading! I hope this intrigues you enough to toss us a follow and stop by our inaugural stream on Wednesday, Nov 9th Nov. 23rd. Well also be posting VODs to Youtube and creating a podcast version for on-the-go enjoyment.

If you would like more information or to learn a bit about our party, check out our website. Im happy to answer questions here as well.

Your Unseen Servant,
Kory


Forum category: Community / Open Topic
Forum thread: New actual play - Level Quest - starts Nov 9th
